text:
Oscar missing from MJ’s property

The Best Picture Oscar statuette, given to producer David O Selznick for the 1939 classic Gone With the Wind , and later bought by late King of Pop Michael Jackson during an auction, is missing from the singer’s estate.

Jackson, a movie buff, had bought the statuette in 1999 for $1.54 million — the most ever spent on an Oscar (the Academy has since imposed rules against selling Oscars). When Jackson died in 2009 at the age of 50, the executors of his estate began taking inventory of the assets the entertainer had left behind. However, the statuette was not found in any of his property. — IANS
title: Gone With the Wind Oscar goes missing
